verses.text: A wise son \add heareth\add* his father's instruction: but a scorner heareth not rebuke.
A man shall eat good by the fruit of \add his\add* mouth: but the soul of the transgressors \add shall eat\add* violence.
He that keepeth his mouth keepeth his life: \add but\add* he that openeth wide his lips shall have destruction.
The soul of the sluggard desireth, and \add hath\add* nothing: but the soul of the diligent shall be made fat.
A righteous \add man\add* hateth lying: but a wicked \add man\add* is lothsome, and cometh to shame.
Righteousness keepeth \add him that is\add* upright in the way: but wickedness overthroweth the sinner.
There is that maketh himself rich, yet \add hath\add* nothing: \add there is\add* that maketh himself poor, yet \add hath\add* great riches.
The ransom of a man's life \add is\add* his riches: but the poor heareth not rebuke.
The light of the righteous rejoiceth: but the lamp of the wicked shall be extinguished.
Only by pride cometh contention: but with the well-advised \add is\add* wisdom.
Wealth \add gotten\add* by vanity shall be diminished: but he that gathereth by labor shall increase.
Hope deferred maketh the heart sick: but \add when\add* the desire cometh, \add it is\add* a tree of life.
Whoever despiseth the word shall be destroyed: but he that feareth the commandment shall be rewarded.
The law of the wise \add is\add* a fountain of life, to depart from the snares of death.
Good understanding giveth favor: but the way of transgressors \add is\add* hard.
Every prudent \add man\add* dealeth with knowledge: but a fool layeth open \add his\add* folly.
A wicked messenger falleth into mischief: but a faithful embassador \add is\add* health.
Poverty and shame \add shall be to\add* him that refuseth instruction: but he that regardeth reproof shall be honored.
The desire accomplished is sweet to the soul: but \add it is\add* abomination to fools to depart from evil.
He that walketh with wise \add men\add* shall be wise: but a companion of fools shall be destroyed.
Evil pursueth sinners: but to the righteous good shall be repaid.
A good \add man\add* leaveth an inheritance to his children's children: and the wealth of the sinner \add is\add* laid up for the just.
Much food \add is in\add* the tillage of the poor: but there is \add that is\add* destroyed for want of judgment.
He that spareth his rod hateth his son: but he that loveth him chasteneth him betimes.
The righteous eateth to the satisfying of his soul: but the belly of the wicked shall want.
